Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. [**Known lastname 13060**] was admitted to the Neurosurgery service and taken to
the Operating Room on [**2166-5-14**] for redo right-sided craniotomy for
resection of brain tumor. She tolerated the procedure well, and
there were no complications.  Please see Operative Report for
full details.  Post-operatively she was transferred to the ICU
for further care, including SBP control and neuro checks. Her
post-operative head CT was stable and her neuro exam remained
nonfocal. Overnight, her post-operative MRI which demonstrated
substantial resection and no obvious residual tumor.
On [**5-15**] she was again stable and cleared for transfer to the
floor. Her dexamethasone was weaned and she was started on
subcutaneous heparin.  She did experience some pain issues
overnight for which she received Dilaudid and Diazepam.  On the
morning of [**5-16**], she reported good pain control and expressed
readiness for discharge home.  She was able to tolerate a
regular diet.  The patient was given detailed precautionary
instructions as well as instructions for follow-up.  She was
discharged home in stable condition.  Surgical pathology was
still pending at the time of discharge.
